[{'created': '2019-10-25 10:34:25.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Ignore volume exceptions during post_live_migration

Previously errors while disconnecting volumes from the source host
during post_live_migration within LibvirtDriver would result in the
overall failure of the migration. This would also mean that while the
instance would be running on the destination it would still be listed as
running on the source within the db.

This change simply ignores any exceptions raised while attempting to
disconnect volumes on the source. These errors can be safely ignored as
they will have no impact on the running instance on the destination.

In the future Nova could wire up the force and ignore_errors kwargs when
calling down into the associated os-brick connectors to help avoid this.

Closes-Bug: #1843639
Change-Id: Ieff5243854321ec40f642845e87a0faecaca8721

commit_message:
libvirt: Ignore volume exceptions during post_live_migration

Previously errors while disconnecting volumes from the source host
during post_live_migration within LibvirtDriver would result in the
overall failure of the migration. This would also mean that while the
instance would be running on the destination it would still be listed as
running on the source within the db.

This change simply ignores any exceptions raised while attempting to
disconnect volumes on the source. These errors can be safely ignored as
they will have no impact on the running instance on the destination.

In the future Nova could wire up the force and ignore_errors kwargs when
calling down into the associated os-brick connectors to help avoid this.

Closes-Bug: #1843639
Change-Id: Ieff5243854321ec40f642845e87a0faecaca8721
(cherry picked from commit ac68cffd43a2f5103c28a2d4b31e087c3f5c24b9)
(cherry picked from commit ff36b6d97ff289ddc34d7776f6a9141b09eb3ad9)
(cherry picked from commit 022ea2819425b5ab3001791455dda36ed638c22d)
(cherry picked from commit a07c612ea6fb8553effecef7454caa179589e916)

I think I had the same thought as Matt R when I looked at this last, which was that this problem affects essentially all instance actions. I backed away from fixing this as it's minor and I couldn't see a way to fix it everywhere which wasn't invasive. Sean's might work, but UnexpectedTaskState can be raised in so many places I'm similarly wary about making this change for a minor issue.

This change is well contained and fixes a part of the problem we have reproduced without creating technical debt. It's ok that it doesn't fix the world."}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2019-10-31 10:32:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Avoid error 500 on shelve task_state race

When shelving a server and saving its new SHELVING task state, we
expect the current task state to be None and do not handle any
UnexpectedTaskStateError exceptions that the database layer may throw
at us. In those cases, we return an error 500 to the user, when in
actuality an error 409 conflict would be more appropriate. This
patch makes the API layer handle UnexpectedTaskStateError exceptions
and return a 409 to the user.

Closes-bug: 1850694
Change-Id: Ie0b421cd5d3a5781c1dd09fab4ed013ece0f939d

commit_message:
Adapt ContainerImagePrepareDebug to the string pattern

Like other *Debug parameters, make it so we first look for
ContainerImagePrepareDebug to be set, otherwise we fallback to Debug;
like we already do in all other OpenStack services.

Related-Bug: #1850934
Change-Id: I0f18b475c69a8ba71b06f517e87caf0d5c209fbb
(cherry picked from commit 1d11972b10b8154d2e4a34c233a7c7c66048f0a9)

commit_message:
Improve handling of empty resource_registry

It's possible that content["resource_registry"] might
not exist or be iterable so wrap the reference to it
with a try/except for a KeyError or TypeError and continue
the deployment without the empty resource_registry instead
of failing.

Change-Id: Ic7d88382a0ff15c24800f12ddbf69f13d6804b28
Closes-Bug: #1833743
(cherry picked from commit 96d39dc106ceacb52977d751dc1ef7dc70490070)

commit_message:
Improve handling of empty resource_registry

It's possible that content["resource_registry"] might
not exist or be iterable so wrap the reference to it
with a try/except for a KeyError or TypeError and continue
the deployment without the empty resource_registry instead
of failing.

Change-Id: Ic7d88382a0ff15c24800f12ddbf69f13d6804b28
Closes-Bug: #1833743
(cherry picked from commit 96d39dc106ceacb52977d751dc1ef7dc70490070)

commit_message:
Switch to devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3 for ceph

We dropped the tempest-full python2 job from our zuul config awhile
back with change I93e938277454a1fc203b3d930ec1bc1eceac0a1e. Since we
track ceph job health by how its failure rate compares with our basic
tempest full job, this updates our config to run the python3 version
of the ceph job by default and drops the python2 version of the job.

Change-Id: I92e01b896751f7f29a0b2b826c33cb2c74b8ced4

subject: "lbaas delete l7 rule" Parameter Passing Error
messages: [{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-11-01 12:07:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/stein.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-11-01 15:11:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-11-01 18:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nClean pick from stable/stein.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-01 12:07:33.000000000', 'message': '"lbaas delete l7 rule" Parameter Passing Error

Description:
Could not delete lbaas l7 rule from l7 policy properly.

In plugin side, we tried to delete the records of l7
rules in the database by the following code
"self.db.self.db.delete_l7policy_rule(context, id, l7policy_id)".

However, in db side, the func delete_l7policy_rule is defined as
" def delete_l7policy_rule(self, context, id):"

Therefore, the parameter "l7policy_id", could not be handled.

As a result, when delete lbaas l7 rule,
the following mistakes will happen:
"TypeError: delete_l7policy_rule() takes exactly 3 arguments (4 given)"

Story: 2005361
Task: 30333

Change-Id: I7c08708ff9d8600b880c4948d41d966c816405fd
(cherry picked from commit 3bf5e2c0268315394c09f5344b5de00589a5e2e0)
'}]
commit_message:
"lbaas delete l7 rule" Parameter Passing Error

Description:
Could not delete lbaas l7 rule from l7 policy properly.

In plugin side, we tried to delete the records of l7
rules in the database by the following code
"self.db.self.db.delete_l7policy_rule(context, id, l7policy_id)".

However, in db side, the func delete_l7policy_rule is defined as
" def delete_l7policy_rule(self, context, id):"

Therefore, the parameter "l7policy_id", could not be handled.

As a result, when delete lbaas l7 rule,
the following mistakes will happen:
"TypeError: delete_l7policy_rule() takes exactly 3 arguments (4 given)"

Story: 2005361
Task: 30333

Change-Id: I7c08708ff9d8600b880c4948d41d966c816405fd
(cherry picked from commit 3bf5e2c0268315394c09f5344b5de00589a5e2e0)

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

zun-ui is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I9134e73c6698e225044282977f40298822280b1c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-01 15:54:26.000000000', 'message': "Document CD mentality policy for nova contributors

The mentality of being able to continuously deliver nova
has been around since the beginning with Rackspace public
cloud trying to CD openstack as close to master as possible.
This has implications for how code series are structured,
reviewed and merged. For the most part this seems to be tribal
knowledge and we don't have anything very obvious in the nova
docs about it, and not all projects in openstack necessarily
subscribe to this mentality anymore, or do so grudgingly, but
it's worth documenting it in nova while still applied here.

Change-Id: Ieff87dbd748318f1b7f879a136ff25081dac321e
"}]
commit_message:
Document CD mentality policy for nova contributors

The mentality of being able to continuously deliver nova
has been around since the beginning with Rackspace public
cloud trying to CD openstack as close to master as possible.
This has implications for how code series are structured,
reviewed and merged. For the most part this seems to be tribal
knowledge and we don't have anything very obvious in the nova
docs about it, and not all projects in openstack necessarily
subscribe to this mentality anymore, or do so grudgingly, but
it's worth documenting it in nova while still applied here.

Change-Id: Ieff87dbd748318f1b7f879a136ff25081dac321e

generic openstack review guidelines but we have nova-specific

commit_message:
doc: link to nova code review guide from dev policies

The development policies section on code review was linking to the
generic openstack review guidelines but we have nova-specific
guidelines as well so this changes the policies page to link to the
nova code review guidelines, links the general guidelines into the
nova page, and also fixes a formatting issue in the nova code review
guidelines page.

Change-Id: I725570d0d737f18fe8b105dc8382c4abcfdef295

[{'created': '2019-09-16 14:51:25.000000000', 'message': "Add Generic Volume Group Into Quota Management

Generic Volume Group currently has it own quota mechanism.
But we can't get or set any information about the Generic
Volume Group quota at API layer.

This patch add Generic Volume Group into quota management.

This is not typically something we would want to backport, but for
the sake of keeping API consistency for later branches that expect
to include this information, the easiest path for all is to just
add this to the stable branch.

Change-Id: I9ff0357984a1e95c1ea8c85f8c508402ef7135ac
Implements: blueprint add-volumegroup-into-quota-management
(cherry picked from commit 608de666fabf9ab65fa905a3b9a95f7cbad83013)
"}]
commit_message:
Add Generic Volume Group Into Quota Management

Generic Volume Group currently has it own quota mechanism.
But we can't get or set any information about the Generic
Volume Group quota at API layer.

This patch add Generic Volume Group into quota management.

This is not typically something we would want to backport, but for
the sake of keeping API consistency for later branches that expect
to include this information, the easiest path for all is to just
add this to the stable branch.

Change-Id: I9ff0357984a1e95c1ea8c85f8c508402ef7135ac
Implements: blueprint add-volumegroup-into-quota-management
(cherry picked from commit 608de666fabf9ab65fa905a3b9a95f7cbad83013)

commit_message:
Ansible 'match' and 'search' is a test not a filter

Older ansible versions used match as a filter but this is no longer
valid, and match and search should be used as a test

Change-Id: I7017220f04fa98ea5d7f1f6e511a395963308b47
(cherry picked from commit 0c1e2c2c0eb7be12cd4c94cedfb14caf9ec7c227)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-31 14:47:39.000000000', 'message': 'Improve handling of empty resource_registry

It's possible that content["resource_registry"] might
not exist or be iterable so wrap the reference to it
with a try/except for a KeyError or TypeError and continue
the deployment without the empty resource_registry instead
of failing.

Change-Id: Ic7d88382a0ff15c24800f12ddbf69f13d6804b28
Closes-Bug: #1833743
(cherry picked from commit 96d39dc106ceacb52977d751dc1ef7dc70490070)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve handling of empty resource_registry

It's possible that content["resource_registry"] might
not exist or be iterable so wrap the reference to it
with a try/except for a KeyError or TypeError and continue
the deployment without the empty resource_registry instead
of failing.

Change-Id: Ic7d88382a0ff15c24800f12ddbf69f13d6804b28
Closes-Bug: #1833743
(cherry picked from commit 96d39dc106ceacb52977d751dc1ef7dc70490070)

commit_message:
Add nova to placement DB migration

While transitioning nova-placement to placement we need
to migrate data [1]. This patch adds this required step for properly
migrating placement with all data.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/placement/latest/admin/upgrade-to-stein.html#migrate-the-data

Change-Id: I4e03ee7c0ead78a1296a8bd8447bce771967d742

[{'created': '2019-10-25 10:34:06.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Ignore volume exceptions during post_live_migration

Previously errors while disconnecting volumes from the source host
during post_live_migration within LibvirtDriver would result in the
overall failure of the migration. This would also mean that while the
instance would be running on the destination it would still be listed as
running on the source within the db.

This change simply ignores any exceptions raised while attempting to
disconnect volumes on the source. These errors can be safely ignored as
they will have no impact on the running instance on the destination.

In the future Nova could wire up the force and ignore_errors kwargs when
calling down into the associated os-brick connectors to help avoid this.

Closes-Bug: #1843639

commit_message:
libvirt: Ignore volume exceptions during post_live_migration

Previously errors while disconnecting volumes from the source host
during post_live_migration within LibvirtDriver would result in the
overall failure of the migration. This would also mean that while the
instance would be running on the destination it would still be listed as
running on the source within the db.

This change simply ignores any exceptions raised while attempting to
disconnect volumes on the source. These errors can be safely ignored as
they will have no impact on the running instance on the destination.

In the future Nova could wire up the force and ignore_errors kwargs when
calling down into the associated os-brick connectors to help avoid this.

Closes-Bug: #1843639
Change-Id: Ieff5243854321ec40f642845e87a0faecaca8721
(cherry picked from commit ac68cffd43a2f5103c28a2d4b31e087c3f5c24b9)
(cherry picked from commit ff36b6d97ff289ddc34d7776f6a9141b09eb3ad9)
(cherry picked from commit 022ea2819425b5ab3001791455dda36ed638c22d)

commit_message:
Fix baremetal serial console autoenable

If ironic_serial_console_autoenable is set to true, ironic compute node
serial consoles are automatically enabled during kayobe overcloud post
configure. However, the baremetal-compute-serial-console.yml playbook
expects a variable called cmd to be defined, and set to 'enable' in
order to enable serial consoles. This patch fixes the issue.

We also add a conditional to only import the playbook when ironic is
enabled in the overcloud.

Change-Id: Ice26a113f9023b1a25a4af0552d07c5e95e64556
Story: 2006662
Task: 36924
(cherry picked from commit 5977a4411921c1880ee023b945ac2cceb533749a)

commit_message:
Ansible 'match' and 'search' is a test not a filter

Older ansible versions used match as a filter but this is no longer
valid, and match and search should be used as a test

Change-Id: I7017220f04fa98ea5d7f1f6e511a395963308b47
(cherry picked from commit 0c1e2c2c0eb7be12cd4c94cedfb14caf9ec7c227)

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Vitrage is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: Ia9339cc6397b680320909f98e4eb8aeb817ab5af

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Use HTTPS for cirros download

Queens only.

The http server for cirros appears to be severely rate limited, and
times out our download. Bifrost switched to https from Rocky onwards.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I41624cc852beacccc27fe2deec979a31cb44ec46

[{'account_id': 31053, 'date': '2019-10-03 13:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-10-03 13:57:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
paunch: use utils.load_config()

Use the new function that supports all use cases when loading
configurations. It supports old and new formats, files and directories.

Depends-On: I917679da22fa09614e73053654df6ce181cf98fe
Change-Id: Ic10d0c28c1a98708c30a1554489b589dd8f255cd

commit_message:
Remove last python2 tests and leftovers

Now that https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688997/ has merged,
the ussuri job template runs pep8, so we can remove the old
one that has the python2 unit test job definition.

Change-Id: I9cb4146fb17ec74169f36205b3e9aaf818aef112

commit_message:
Do not install Open vSwitch

Open vSwitch packages are no longer present in the default, or EPEL
repoistories. This means there is no clean way to install Open vSwitch
on CentOS. Instead, we should leave it up the user to decide how to
install it.

Change-Id: Ie56296230c9840e542ac70d96dc68c285d198ad6

@Goutham Pacha Ravi
Thank you for the review, but I have a question on share['id'] vs share['share_id']. I did the research and still do not see a situation where we would have multiple shares backing a logical share in a ZFS environment. Could you please explain why/when this would be the case in more detail?"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-07-08 21:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> Thank you for the review, but I have a question on share['id'] vs share['share_id']. I did the research and still do not see a situation where we would have multiple shares backing a logical share in a ZFS environment. Could you please explain why/when this would be the case in more detail?


You can have multiple share instances only when replicating a share or migrating a share to a different backend. When a user creates a share, the payload sent down to the share driver is a "ShareInstance" [1]. The Nexenta driver currently does not support share replication; but, if it does; here's what happens when a user creates a replica for the share:

- A new share instance [1] entity is created in the manila database, 
- the destination backend driver is asked to create a share replica with the new share instance entity as the payload [2]. 

Now, if the driver names backend shares with share['share_id']; this can get confusing; because the primary share, and it's replica are both named the same. This confusion exacerbates if your backend supports replicating one source share to multiple destinations. 

The situation with share migration is very similar.


So, my ask is that you consider using "share['id']" to name your backend resources. For existing shares, you can use a lookup function that falls back to share["share_id"] if you can't find a share named with share['id']. 

Am open to thoughts on this matter. This problem need not be solved right away, since your backend does not currently support share replication, or driver optimized share migration. 

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/commit/da4b33344c0a71e0450a21c8a32bb4535ff19ae6/manila/db/sqlalchemy/models.py#L332
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/commit/da4b33344c0a71e0450a21c8a32bb4535ff19ae6/manila/share/manager.py#L1940'}, {'account_id': 15439, 'date': '2019-07-19 18:00:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2019-07-19 21:40:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Try this:

I'm okay with this code, we have a couple of unaddressed issues:

- Missing documentation: https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1619457
We closed that bug as "Won't fix" because there was no response... Typically, a manila driver will have some documentation in administrator and configuration guides:

Admin docs for other drivers: https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/admin/index.html#supported-share-back-ends
Configuration reference for other drivers:
https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/configuration/shared-file-systems/drivers.html

There's also the driver feature matrix: https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/admin/share_back_ends_feature_support_mapping.html 
This needs to be updated with the new features implemented (revert_to_snapshot, manage/unmanage). 

Could you fix these issues? Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 15439, 'date': '2019-08-16 15:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

commit_message:
[Nexenta] Refactored NexentaStor5 NFS driver

- Support for storage pool failover
- Implemented NEF objects interfaces in jsonrpc
- Manage existing support.
- Revert to snapshot support.

Implements: blueprint refactored-nexentastor5-nfs-driver

Closes-Bug: #1619457

Change-Id: I6f7483c35ac0af644a77b18a449480367a8c100c

[{'created': '2019-10-31 17:41:29.000000000', 'message': 'lint: maintenance chores

- avoid false-positives from ansible-lint
- bumped linters to current versions
- moved duplicated flake8 config to recommended location (setup.cfg)
- removed individual lint envs from tox.ini

We are also forced to fix some issues that went in because linter was
not fully running.

Addressed bug described at:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible-lint/issues/611

Change-Id: Ifc8640fa823dd47a1ad1d9de9f51d9472118048c
'}]
commit_message:
lint: maintenance chores

- avoid false-positives from ansible-lint
- bumped linters to current versions
- moved duplicated flake8 config to recommended location (setup.cfg)
- removed individual lint envs from tox.ini

We are also forced to fix some issues that went in because linter was
not fully running.

Addressed bug described at:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible-lint/issues/611

Change-Id: Ifc8640fa823dd47a1ad1d9de9f51d9472118048c

commit_message:
Add new config to disable openrc_v2 in horizon

it's now possible to remove the openstack rc file v2 from horizon download list.

Change-Id: I7aa8d7a911585e00d8ede92bf909492cf70cba6e
(cherry picked from commit 10aa884a1655a4ebde559f5770824fe68cd1ba35)

commit_message:
Drop rabbitmq_apply_openstack_policies

As we set rabbitmq_policies is groups_vars there's no need
to include the same policy for rabbitmq one more time.

Change-Id: I0c0afda6022b1e5d5f560565fd7a74877c69e2cf

commit_message:
Bump version to 0.0.7

Note that there was a jump from 0.0.5 to 0.0.7. This is due
to an error during last release that mistakenly tagged commit
71d12999b06908bbb019f69c89361bd44bec316c as 0.0.5 when it
should have bumped to 0.0.6.

Change-Id: Icfa6f0d0e3fb08ba17ddf9ec32a9309f8f78fc9c

[{'created': '2019-11-01 08:14:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add Centos GPG key custom url

When using a custom repo with repo_centos_epel_mirror, you maybe need to

Change-Id: I9bb305d866f3d65653b95a25a5b9f5ecde5af0b0

commit_message:
Add Centos GPG key custom url

When using a custom repo with repo_centos_epel_mirror, you maybe need to
change the gpg key url because offline env

You can use this variable: repo_centos_epel_key

Change-Id: I9bb305d866f3d65653b95a25a5b9f5ecde5af0b0
(cherry picked from commit aecff065f1c07ff321e62d8bd9718a462019b53d)

commit_message:
Make corrections to pod lifecycle upgrade values

It was observed in some charts' values.yaml that the values defining
lifecycle upgrade parameters were incorrectly placed.

This change aims to correct these instances by adding a deployment-
type subkey corresponding with the deployment types identified in
the chart's templates dir, and indenting the values appropriately.

Change-Id: Id5437b1eeaf6e71472520f1fee91028c9b6bfdd3

Change-Id: I7017220f04fa98ea5d7f1f6e511a395963308b47
"}, {'created': '2019-11-01 11:53:49.000000000', 'message': "Ansible 'match' and 'search' is a test not a filter

Change-Id: I7017220f04fa98ea5d7f1f6e511a395963308b47
"}]
commit_message:
Ansible 'match' and 'search' is a test not a filter

Older ansible versions used match as a filter but this is no longer
valid, and match and search should be used as a test

Change-Id: I7017220f04fa98ea5d7f1f6e511a395963308b47

commit_message:
Rename Leap 15.0 to 15

Rename the Leap 15.0 (opensuse-150) job to
Leap 15 (opensuse-15) so that we can be more easily updating this
to the opensuse-15 nodepool image (which is opensuse 15.1)

this backports changes https://review.opendev.org/660123 and change
https://review.opendev.org/680450/.

Change-Id: I01feece468b2df904b7e1d0c04e36fb7240e7f0d
(cherry picked from commit 09c7bd99b6ea948393979d5767639042eda88d46)

commit_message:
Use Horizon project template for django jobs

Horizon defined a project template 'horizon-non-primary-django-jobs'
for django jobs. This patch use that template to run django jobs
here and also fixes failed test cases for django2.2 support.
For information please refer [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681969/

Change-Id: I3ab81402633b9abe39e49c3921585db992050540

Here is a failure for this bug w/o this fix applied:

http://logs.openstack.org/74/467674/8/check/tempest-full/85ce366/controller/logs/screen-n-api.txt.gz#_Jul_14_13_15_45_353129

Jul 14 13:15:45.353129 ubuntu-xenial-rax-ord-0000724494 devstack@n-api.service[7907]: INFO nova.api.openstack.wsgi [None req-e00a77d1-059b-441a-8066-b41fb1b0189e tempest-ServersTestBootFromVolume-790920514 tempest-ServersTestBootFromVolume-790920514] HTTP exception thrown: Invalid volume: Instance 78a79f08-6f1b-4001-b949-bed0121f7e25 and volume 9e0228ff-3c06-4a26-a8b6-915e23c08d50 are not in the same availability_zone. Instance is in None. Volume is in nova

I wonder, if we're booting from volume and the user didn't request a specific AZ but they are building from an existing volume, why wouldn't we just set the instance.availability_zone to the volume availability_zone as if the user *did* request the same AZ for both? The only thing is I think we have weird scenarios if the user requests 'nova' as the AZ:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/aggregates.html#availability-zones-azs"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-15 13:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Unless I'm missing why it's hard, I think we should move some of the nova-specific logic up to compute/api instead of having it buried in cinder.py. That, and I think we need to consider more than just the root bdm, unless I'm missing something.

Otherwise, this seems like an obviously-important fix to me."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-13 17:08:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-21 16:14:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I realize it's been a long time since I've done anything about this. I'm uncomfortable with unit tests for this really, so I think before proceeding on a fix for this I think I'm going to write some functional tests so we have an in-tree functional test basis which will allow me to drop my devstack DNM patch that recreates this, then we can iterate on solutions. A couple of test cases to implement (all with [cinder]/cross_az_attach=False):

1. Obviously the one in the bug where you boot from a volume without requesting a specific AZ so we fail.

2. A case where we boot from volume but default_schedule_zone is set to something that matches the volume AZ and we pass.

3. Test with volume-backed (root volume) and non-volume-backed, e.g. boot from image as the root disk but with a data volume attached and that pre-existing volume is in some other AZ ('nova' by default I guess)."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-23 21:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-31 22:45:56.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Default AZ for instance if cross_az_attach=False and checking from API

If we're booting from an existing volume but the instance is not being
created in a requested availabiliy zone, and cross_az_attach=False,
we'll fail with a 400 since by default the volume is in the 'nova'
AZ and the instance does not have an AZ set - because one wasn't requested
and because it's not in a host aggregate yet.

This plumbs a flag down from the API code during boot from volume which
instructs the check_availability_zone method to use the default AZ
config option if the instance doesn't have an AZ set, which with the
default AZ options in nova and cinder will be sufficient for the standard
case where the user doesn't request an AZ for either the volume or the
server instance.

Change-Id: Ib31ba2cbff0ebb22503172d8801b6e0c3d2aa68a
Closes-Bug: #1694844
"}, {'created': '2017-05-31 22:50:51.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Default AZ for instance if cross_az_attach=False and checking from API

If we're booting from an existing volume but the instance is not being
created in a requested availabiliy zone, and cross_az_attach=False,
we'll fail with a 400 since by default the volume is in the 'nova'
AZ and the instance does not have an AZ set - because one wasn't requested
and because it's not in a host aggregate yet.

This plumbs a flag down from the API code during boot from volume which
instructs the check_availability_zone method to use the default AZ
config option if the instance doesn't have an AZ set, which with the
default AZ options in nova and cinder will be sufficient for the standard
case where the user doesn't request an AZ for either the volume or the
server instance.

Change-Id: Ib31ba2cbff0ebb22503172d8801b6e0c3d2aa68a
Closes-Bug: #1694844
"}, {'created': '2018-07-15 14:17:39.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Default AZ for instance if cross_az_attach=False and checking from API

If we're booting from an existing volume but the instance is not being
created in a requested availabiliy zone, and cross_az_attach=False,
we'll fail with a 400 since by default the volume is in the 'nova'
AZ and the instance does not have an AZ set - because one wasn't requested
and because it's not in a host aggregate yet.

This plumbs a flag down from the API code during boot from volume which
instructs the check_availability_zone method to use the default AZ
config option(s) if the instance doesn't have an AZ set, which with the
default AZ options in nova and cinder will be sufficient for the standard
case where the user doesn't request an AZ for either the volume or the
server instance.

If the [DEFAULT]/default_schedule_zone (for instances) is not set and
the volume AZ does not match the [DEFAULT]/default_availability_zone
then we put the volume AZ in the request spec as if the user requested
that AZ when creating the server.

Change-Id: Ib31ba2cbff0ebb22503172d8801b6e0c3d2aa68a
Closes-Bug: #1694844

and because it's not in a host aggregate yet.

This refactors that AZ validation during server create in the API to
do it before calling _validate_bdm so we get the pre-existing volumes
early and if cross_az_attach=False, we validate the volume zone(s) against
the instance AZ. If the [DEFAULT]/default_schedule_zone (for instances) is
not set and the volume AZ does not match the
[DEFAULT]/default_availability_zone then we put the volume AZ in the request
spec as if the user requested that AZ when creating the server.

Since this is a change in how cross_az_attach is used and how the instance
default AZ works when using BDMs for pre-existing volumes, the docs are
updated and a release note is added.

Note that not all of the API code paths are unit tested because the
functional test coverage does most of the heavy lifting for coverage.
Given the amount of unit tests that are impacted by this change, it is
pretty obvious that (1) many unit tests are mocking at too low a level and
(2) functional tests are better for validating these flows.

Closes-Bug: #1694844

Change-Id: Ib31ba2cbff0ebb22503172d8801b6e0c3d2aa68a

commit_message:
Default AZ for instance if cross_az_attach=False and checking from API

If we're booting from an existing volume but the instance is not being
created in a requested availability zone, and cross_az_attach=False,
we'll fail with a 400 since by default the volume is in the 'nova'
AZ and the instance does not have an AZ set - because one wasn't requested
and because it's not in a host aggregate yet.

This refactors that AZ validation during server create in the API to
do it before calling _validate_bdm so we get the pre-existing volumes
early and if cross_az_attach=False, we validate the volume zone(s) against
the instance AZ. If the [DEFAULT]/default_schedule_zone (for instances) is
not set and the volume AZ does not match the
[DEFAULT]/default_availability_zone then we put the volume AZ in the request
spec as if the user requested that AZ when creating the server.

Since this is a change in how cross_az_attach is used and how the instance
default AZ works when using BDMs for pre-existing volumes, the docs are
updated and a release note is added.

Note that not all of the API code paths are unit tested because the
functional test coverage does most of the heavy lifting for coverage.
Given the amount of unit tests that are impacted by this change, it is
pretty obvious that (1) many unit tests are mocking at too low a level and
(2) functional tests are better for validating these flows.

Closes-Bug: #1694844

Change-Id: Ib31ba2cbff0ebb22503172d8801b6e0c3d2aa68a

commit_message:
Variable name accidentally being templated out

Seeing <VirtualHost 0.0.0.0:horizon_listen_ports.http> in
openstack-dashboard.conf instead of the port number.
Removed unnecessary quotes in the ternary so the variable works.

Change-Id: I126c03267361abfe894b17dc97c76a19a6b090dc
(cherry picked from commit f64c3d8fd71ec20f2209e83a34426174d6456f63)

commit_message:
Drop support for Ubuntu Xenial

Attempts to deploy on Xenial will fail and references to Xenial are
removed from the documentation

commit_message:
Fix playbooks for Ansible 2.9

The version_compare filter was renamed to version and changed to be a
test in 2.5. The old filter was removed in 2.9.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ib5d91b5fc53d0f6d16dd6eb38121cd9914e33d93

subject: Fix rabbitmq dependency
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-01 09:17:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix rabbitmq dependency

puppetlabs/rabbitmq [1] is deprecated, and max version is 5.6.0 which
can not be fulfilled by this dependency.

Correct it to puppet-rabbitmq [2] instead which is being actively
maintained and has the right version.

[1] https://forge.puppet.com/puppetlabs/rabbitmq
[2] https://forge.puppet.com/puppet/rabbitmq

Change-Id: I4264d4a998226b91da14949be5b0a4b41848a1ba
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq dependency

puppetlabs/rabbitmq [1] is deprecated, and max version is 5.6.0 which
can not be fulfilled by this dependency.

Correct it to puppet-rabbitmq [2] instead which is being actively
maintained and has the right version.

[1] https://forge.puppet.com/puppetlabs/rabbitmq
[2] https://forge.puppet.com/puppet/rabbitmq

Change-Id: I4264d4a998226b91da14949be5b0a4b41848a1ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-14 06:56:05.000000000', 'message': '"lbaas delete l7 rule" Parameter Passing Error

Description:
Could not delete lbaas l7 rule from l7 policy properly.

In plugin side, we tried to delete the records of l7
rules in the database by the following code
"self.db.self.db.delete_l7policy_rule(context, id, l7policy_id)".

However, in db side, the func delete_l7policy_rule is defined as
" def delete_l7policy_rule(self, context, id):"

Therefore, the parameter "l7policy_id", could not be handled.

As a result, when delete lbaas l7 rule,
the following mistakes will happen:
"TypeError: delete_l7policy_rule() takes exactly 3 arguments (4 given)"

Change-Id: I7c08708ff9d8600b880c4948d41d966c816405fd
Closes-Bug: #2005362
'}, {'created': '2019-06-14 07:09:20.000000000', 'message': '"lbaas delete l7 rule" Parameter Passing Error

commit_message:
"lbaas delete l7 rule" Parameter Passing Error

Description:
Could not delete lbaas l7 rule from l7 policy properly.

In plugin side, we tried to delete the records of l7
rules in the database by the following code
"self.db.self.db.delete_l7policy_rule(context, id, l7policy_id)".

However, in db side, the func delete_l7policy_rule is defined as
" def delete_l7policy_rule(self, context, id):"

Therefore, the parameter "l7policy_id", could not be handled.

As a result, when delete lbaas l7 rule,
the following mistakes will happen:
"TypeError: delete_l7policy_rule() takes exactly 3 arguments (4 given)"

Story: 2005361
Task: 30333

Change-Id: I7c08708ff9d8600b880c4948d41d966c816405fd

commit_message:
Install python3 distro packages in the utility playbook

For distros that support python3, use the python3 distro packages
for the openstack client when using the 'distro' install method.

Disable Queens periodic publishing jobs

Queens is now in Extended Maintenance, and we have agreed to stop
publishing images at this point.

commit_message:
Change featurset for octavia standalone to support full tempest

Switches featureset to 62 to add support for obtaining amphora image so
tempest can be run against a fully configured octavia.

Change-Id: I8531620cea0cb576a03079cf4935e9537bb9f98d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-31 13:23:10.000000000', 'message': 'Do not rely on when_file_change for systemd reload

Systemd was not relying being reloaded when the definition
file for aodh-api changed. The reload was supposed to be
triggered by the when_file_changed decorator. However,
there are a number of issues with when_file_changed decorator (*1,
*2, *3) and the decorator has now been deprecated *4.

This change ensures the reload happens without relying on
the decorator.

*1 https://github.com/juju-solutions/charms.reactive/issues/25
*2 https://github.com/juju-solutions/charms.reactive/issues/44
*3 https://github.com/juju-solutions/charms.reactive/issues/49
*4 https://github.com/juju-solutions/charms.reactive/issues/44#issuecomment-438472843

Closes-Bug: #1850767

Change-Id: I7c528a53a4de8a4a85bf655fc242b0f38fd0754b
'}]
commit_message:
Do not rely on when_file_change for systemd reload

Systemd was not relying being reloaded when the definition
file for aodh-api changed. The reload was supposed to be
triggered by the when_file_changed decorator. However,
there are a number of issues with when_file_changed decorator (*1,
*2, *3) and the decorator has now been deprecated *4.

This change ensures the reload happens without relying on
the decorator.

*1 https://github.com/juju-solutions/charms.reactive/issues/25
*2 https://github.com/juju-solutions/charms.reactive/issues/44
*3 https://github.com/juju-solutions/charms.reactive/issues/49
*4 https://github.com/juju-solutions/charms.reactive/issues/44#issuecomment-438472843

Closes-Bug: #1850767

Change-Id: I7c528a53a4de8a4a85bf655fc242b0f38fd0754b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-01 07:18:35.000000000', 'message': 'Allow vault to bind to all addresses

the 0.0.0.0 syntax just configures Vault to bind
to all availabler IPv4 addresses on a system, while
the [::] syntax allows binding on all v4 and v6
addresses

Change-Id: I87ba30e9c3f92abe75fb25c6cf5a56f8aa180378
'}]
commit_message:
Allow vault to bind to all addresses

the 0.0.0.0 syntax just configures Vault to bind
to all availabler IPv4 addresses on a system, while
the [::] syntax allows binding on all v4 and v6
addresses

Change-Id: I87ba30e9c3f92abe75fb25c6cf5a56f8aa180378

> There are some IPMI operations that could be dangerous to stop in the middle -- we permit raw bytes which means that could be basically *any* command.


Thank you, Jay, for taking a look!

Could you please elaborate when is it dangerous to interrupt ipmitool? It feels like IPMI communication can stop at any moment anyway because of its the non-transactional nature. For example ironic conductor could be rebooted or network can go down in the middle of IPMI exchange...

Also, what are those safe-to-interrupt IPMI commands? I think we are mostly interested in power status here because this command is the most common and the first to go in ironic work flow.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-10-30 08:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Jay, the alternative approach would be to carefully set up ipmitool time outs [1] in hope that it would yield reasonably predictably...

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/607949/'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:19:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The raw bytes is the only specific case I know of -- there are also IPMI methods that update firmware, but it doesn't appear Ironic uses any of those."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-11-01 16:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-11-01 16:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> The raw bytes is the only specific case I know of -- there are also IPMI methods that update firmware, but it doesn't appear Ironic uses any of those.

Alright, this patch will only kill "power status" calls.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2018-11-01 18:52:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build succeeded.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-12 11:23:59.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Kill misbehaving `ipmitool` process

We can't trust ipmitool to terminate in time. We
may have to kill the process if it's running for
longer than we asked it to.

For that purpose we inject the time-capped `popen.wait` call
before the uncapped `popen.communicate` is called internally.
Then just kill stuck `ipmitool` process and go on.

Change-Id: I7e1eafb334fe3a3337926aca27c14fe559ce0e39
"}, {'created': '2018-10-29 14:25:02.000000000', 'message': "Kill misbehaving `ipmitool` process

We can't trust ipmitool to terminate in time. We
may have to kill the process if it's running for
longer than we asked it to.

For that purpose we inject the time-capped `popen.wait` call
before the uncapped `popen.communicate` is called internally.
Then just kill stuck `ipmitool` process and go on.

Change-Id: I7e1eafb334fe3a3337926aca27c14fe559ce0e39
"}, {'created': '2018-10-29 22:54:24.000000000', 'message': "Kill misbehaving `ipmitool` process

may have to kill the process if it's running for
longer than we asked it to.

For that purpose we inject the time-capped `popen.wait` call

Change-Id: I7e1eafb334fe3a3337926aca27c14fe559ce0e39
"}, {'created': '2018-11-01 16:25:38.000000000', 'message': 'Kill misbehaving `ipmitool` process

We can't trust ipmitool to terminate in time. We
may have to kill the process if it's running for
longer than we asked it to.

On the other hand, abrupt IPMI exchange termination is said to be
dangerous to the state of the BMC being managed. Therefore this patch
only kills timed out IPMI "power status" call.

For the purpose of killing hung `ipmitool` we inject the time-capped
`popen.wait` call before the uncapped `popen.communicate` is called

commit_message:
Kill misbehaving `ipmitool` process

We can't trust ipmitool to terminate in time. We may have to kill
the process if it's running for longer than we asked it to.

On the other hand, abrupt IPMI exchange termination is said to be
dangerous to the state of the BMC being managed. Therefore this patch
only kills timed out IPMI "power status" call.

For the purpose of killing hung `ipmitool` we inject the time-capped
`popen.wait` call before the uncapped `popen.communicate` is called
internally. Then just kill stuck `ipmitool` process and go on.

Story: 2004449
Task: 28127
Change-Id: I7e1eafb334fe3a3337926aca27c14fe559ce0e39

commit_message:
Adjust base_centos_yum_repo_packages for master

Kolla upstream is adding centos-release-openstack-train release rpm in
master branch after [1]. In tripleo builds this means it's configuring
both RDO Trunk master (delorean) repos and CloudSIG train repo. Mixing
both sets of repos can lead to undesired results so I'm removing
centos-release-openstack-train repo from config and letting
tripleo-repos configure as needed.

Also, I'm removing leftovers from old Ceph releases configuration.
Currently kolla is installing centos-release-ceph-nautilus so, tripleo
does not need to overrides it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689706

Change-Id: Ia551a7d2351bb91cc45e9c2d12f4afb4f6368bb7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-25 10:33:40.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Ignore volume exceptions during post_live_migration

Previously errors while disconnecting volumes from the source host
during post_live_migration within LibvirtDriver would result in the
overall failure of the migration. This would also mean that while the
instance would be running on the destination it would still be listed as
running on the source within the db.

This change simply ignores any exceptions raised while attempting to
disconnect volumes on the source. These errors can be safely ignored as
they will have no impact on the running instance on the destination.

In the future Nova could wire up the force and ignore_errors kwargs when
calling down into the associated os-brick connectors to help avoid this.

Closes-Bug: #1843639
Change-Id: Ieff5243854321ec40f642845e87a0faecaca8721
(cherry picked from commit ac68cffd43a2f5103c28a2d4b31e087c3f5c24b9)
(cherry picked from commit ff36b6d97ff289ddc34d7776f6a9141b09eb3ad9)
'}, {'created': '2019-10-25 20:47:30.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Ignore volume exceptions during post_live_migration

Previously errors while disconnecting volumes from the source host
during post_live_migration within LibvirtDriver would result in the
overall failure of the migration. This would also mean that while the
instance would be running on the destination it would still be listed as
running on the source within the db.

This change simply ignores any exceptions raised while attempting to
disconnect volumes on the source. These errors can be safely ignored as
they will have no impact on the running instance on the destination.

commit_message:
libvirt: Ignore volume exceptions during post_live_migration

Previously errors while disconnecting volumes from the source host
during post_live_migration within LibvirtDriver would result in the
overall failure of the migration. This would also mean that while the
instance would be running on the destination it would still be listed as
running on the source within the db.

This change simply ignores any exceptions raised while attempting to
disconnect volumes on the source. These errors can be safely ignored as
they will have no impact on the running instance on the destination.

In the future Nova could wire up the force and ignore_errors kwargs when
calling down into the associated os-brick connectors to help avoid this.

NOTE(mriedem): The driver.py change is slightly different from Train
because pep F841 was not enforced starting in Train but is in Stein.

Closes-Bug: #1843639
Change-Id: Ieff5243854321ec40f642845e87a0faecaca8721
(cherry picked from commit ac68cffd43a2f5103c28a2d4b31e087c3f5c24b9)
(cherry picked from commit ff36b6d97ff289ddc34d7776f6a9141b09eb3ad9)

commit_message:
Add Centos GPG key custom url

When using a custom repo with repo_centos_epel_mirror, you maybe need to
change the gpg key url because offline env

You can use this variable: repo_centos_epel_key

Change-Id: I9bb305d866f3d65653b95a25a5b9f5ecde5af0b0

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs and remove unnecessary requirements

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: Ifbd7e36c4617f469f309dc5f4f774d040ee4620d

[{'created': '2019-10-14 15:00:31.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor rebuild_instance

This patch moves the creation of the rebuild_claim from rebuild_instance
to _do_rebuild_instance_with_claim() helper so that in later patches
more code can be added to _do_rebuild_instance_with_claim right
before the rebuild_claim is created without dealing with deep nesting
in rebuild_instance.

Change-Id: Icf445ed185086e7add31bc921fd3d3a45344a887
'}, {'created': '2019-10-18 09:14:13.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor rebuild_instance

This patch moves the creation of the rebuild_claim from rebuild_instance
to _do_rebuild_instance_with_claim() helper so that in later patches
more code can be added to _do_rebuild_instance_with_claim right
before the rebuild_claim is created without dealing with deep nesting
in rebuild_instance.

Change-Id: Icf445ed185086e7add31bc921fd3d3a45344a887
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor rebuild_instance

This patch moves the creation of the rebuild_claim from rebuild_instance
to _do_rebuild_instance_with_claim() helper so that in later patches
more code can be added to _do_rebuild_instance_with_claim right
before the rebuild_claim is created without dealing with deep nesting
in rebuild_instance.

Change-Id: Icf445ed185086e7add31bc921fd3d3a45344a887

commit_message:
Add metal upgrade jobs

This patch adds jobs for both CentOS 7 and Ubuntu upgrades to
run in check and gate to ensure that we don't break upgrade paths.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/690072
Change-Id: I3609d68769075c8bbee77214f3790b89692dd0b0

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

commit_message:
Derives NovaPCIPassthrough per SR-IOV node

This change is used to derive the pci_passthrough_whitelist parameters
automatically for all the SR-IOV nodes.

commit_message:
Upgrade pylint to a new version that works with python3.7

1.The pylint & astroid verison should be specified for python3.7
pylint is upgrade 2.3.1
astroid is upgrade 2.2.0

2.Some rules are added to the ignore list in .pylintrc

Change-Id: Id5f91aa5dd22b1364fe35143b6c96e834284d252

[{'created': '2019-10-30 21:30:14.000000000', 'message': 'TestOVNMechanismDriverPortSecurity: set mtu value

uninitialized mtu value for OVN ml2.

    neutron_lib.exceptions.InvalidInput:
        Invalid input for operation:
            Requested MTU is too big, maximum is 1450.

Change-Id: I3b028e2e47ba6bcc5f56748c695f1ed2f91c2b02
'}]
commit_message:
TestOVNMechanismDriverPortSecurity: set mtu value

Avoid the following exception which, will happen due to
uninitialized mtu value for OVN ml2.

    neutron_lib.exceptions.InvalidInput:
        Invalid input for operation:
            Requested MTU is too big, maximum is 1450.

Related change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679399/

Change-Id: I3b028e2e47ba6bcc5f56748c695f1ed2f91c2b02

support events

Events are valuable for understanding system state, so we need to
continue to support them.

commit_message:
Do deepcopy when copying templates

test_template is defined as a dict, so do a deepcopy
instead.

Change-Id: I0f7d222d5f95aa8e8ed73ae0d7a100470271e113
Closes-Bug: #1766448

@Gordon Yeah, I know the Telemetry team is short handed (like the rest of us :) ) so I don't plan on just dumping this code on the team.  We are currently using this functionality and plan to continue to maintain it.  The hope from the team is that sharing this functionality through Ceilometer will make it more useful to the community and keep us integrated."}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-04-24 01:54:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15843, 'date': '2018-04-24 02:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I won't talk about the code quality/integration in the ceilometer base.
I just want to say that from the Cloudkitty's PTL point of view that I have, that integration would be really great. We are already able to fetch metrics from ceilometer and monasca (using ceilosca) and that integration would clearly ease the process (no need to install additional elements by instance).
And it is so much important to provide such integration within different OpenStack projects."}, {'account_id': 11580, 'date': '2018-05-07 14:59:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-05-15 08:28:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-06-06 11:56:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Did some renaming to hopefully make the intent of some options clearer, and removed two options that are no longer used.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-06-17 15:29:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+1

Tested patch set 17 in devstack today, works for me. One remark though: In monasca metrics provided by ceilometer's monasca publisher, the project_id is in the "project_id" dimension. However, for metrics provided by the libvirt plugin (vm.* and nova.vm.*), the dimension is called "tenant_id". Being consistent between metrics of both types would be nice. Simply adding a "tenant_id" dimension in addition to "project_id" to samples published by ceilometer would be enough.

Appart from that, everything is looking good to me, looking forward to see this merged! :-)'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-06-18 04:01:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

Luka: thanks for the review. :)  Good catch on that, I hadn't thought to compare the standards on project_id/tenant_id.  My first thought was that we should be standardizing on the 'newer' term of project_id, but having both as you suggested seems like an easy approach.
I do see a mix of project_id used (the monasca-transform generated _agg metrics also use project_id).  I will file a separate story for tracking some standardization."}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-06-18 08:46:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-07-10 03:11:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

If you feel it needs some urgency, I can talk to my team and see if I can pass on some work."}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-07-11 13:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

This is just a quick change to address Pierre's point and rebase on master.  I'll take another look at zhurong's comments, though this version should be functional."}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-08-20 00:35:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

Hi Joseph. Thanks for the update but please do not +1 your own patch since it will confuse reviewers. It may take a while to review this patchset so please be patient. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-08-30 23:20:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: -Code-Review

ceilometer repo may be beneficial.

'}, {'created': '2018-06-12 05:24:10.000000000', 'message': 'publisher: Contribute the Monasca publisher

The Ceilosca (monasca-ceilometer) publisher has been around for a
few years. The MonascaPublisher acts as another Ceilometer
publisher and sends selected metrics on to the Monasca API for
storage, aggregation, alarming, etc.  Once metrics are in Monasca,
they may be retrieved through the Monasca API or with the
python-monascaclient. This Ceilosca functionality is a key
component for metering in several distributions and is used in
many customer installations.

With the removal of the Ceilometer v2 API (which allowed the
removal of the Ceilosca storage driver, shrinking the Ceilosca
code base) and continuing changes to Ceilometer, a tighter
integration with the ceilometer repo may be beneficial to keep
both Monasca and Telemetry in sync.

Change-Id: I2cbce160503e23dfbde375722a3bd100ec86494e
Story: 2001239
Task: 5769
'}, {'created': '2018-06-12 14:22:22.000000000', 'message': 'publisher: Contribute the Monasca publisher

commit_message:
publisher: Contribute the Monasca publisher

The Ceilosca (monasca-ceilometer) publisher has been around since
before the Mitaka release and has been used in production for years.
The MonascaPublisher acts as another Ceilometer publisher and sends
selected metrics on to the Monasca API for storage, aggregation,
alarming, etc.  Once metrics are in Monasca, they may be retrieved
through the Monasca API or with the python-monascaclient. This
Ceilosca functionality is a key component for metering in several
distributions and is used in many customer installations.

With the removal of the Ceilometer v2 API (which allowed the
removal of the Ceilosca storage driver, shrinking the Ceilosca
code base) and continuing changes to Ceilometer, a tighter
integration with the ceilometer repo may be beneficial to keep
both Monasca and Telemetry in sync.

Change-Id: I2cbce160503e23dfbde375722a3bd100ec86494e
Story: 2001239
Task: 5769

commit_message:
Dynamic pollsters to support nested dictionary values

The goal of this PR is to allow operators to use nested
keys when defining an attribute to be used as value or
as the response key where the entries to be processed
are found.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691659/
Change-Id: I7df4a5e630ccb646291be967b2289552cc69829c
Signed-off-by: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>

[{'created': '2019-10-28 11:13:04.000000000', 'message': 'Dynamic pollsters to handle different response entries structures

This PR addressed a concern raised by Lingxian Kong on
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677031. The dynamic pollsters were using
just the first key to the response that is received when we call an
OpenStack API. However, the operator might call an API that returns
directly the list of elements (e.g. AODH alarms). Therefore, we want to
enable operators to handle those APIs as well. Moreover, we are
improving the system and allowing operators to define the key of the
list in the response that he/she wants to handle.

Change-Id: Ie0439f5555c1fbc651632bb84040ca794b203139

commit_message:
Dynamic pollsters to handle different response structures

This PR addressed a concern raised by Lingxian Kong on
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677031. The dynamic pollsters were using
just the first key to the response that is received when we call an
OpenStack API. However, the operator might call an API that returns
directly the list of elements (e.g. AODH alarms). Therefore, we want to
enable operators to handle those APIs as well. Moreover, we are
improving the system and allowing operators to define the key of the
list in the response that he/she wants to handle.

Change-Id: Ie0439f5555c1fbc651632bb84040ca794b203139
Signed-off-by: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>

messages:
[{'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2019-10-17 05:32:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-10-17 09:20:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-10-17 11:19:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Does the old way for in Train? I understand that we might have missed the deadline on this but this is a feature (that alters existing behaviour) and deprecations being backported which pretty much breaks the backporting policy on most points [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/puppet-openstack-guide/latest/contributor/backporting.html'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-10-17 12:23:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> Does the old way for in Train? I understand that we might have
 > missed the deadline on this but this is a feature (that alters
 > existing behaviour) and deprecations being backported which pretty
 > much breaks the backporting policy on most points [1].
 > 
 > [1] https://docs.openstack.org/puppet-openstack-guide/latest/contributor/backporting.html

yes, I was thinking the same but vcpu_pin_set got deprecated in
nova in train with [2]. How should we handle it when it gets
removed in nova in u? Wouldn't it make sense to have nova and
puppet-nova in sync with deprecation of config settings or we
need to make them aware of the delay in puppet-nova?
In general I think we could keep vcpu_pin_set as not deprecated
with the downside mentioned above.

[2] https://review.opendev.org/671793"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-10-31 10:48:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I agree Nova & puppet-nova should be in sync and the parameter is well deprecated, the deployment won't fail and the right configuration will be applied; just a warning will be shown; which is imho ok at this point.
Let's just not make it an habit."}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-10-31 10:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-10-31 13:37:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

So this doesn't go against our stable policy because it continues to have the old configuration. The fail configuration is if someone tries to use the new one with the old one still set. Unfortunately we have to mirror the upstream service configurations so IMHO this change mirrors the changes in nova which would make sense to have in Train."}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2019-11-01 00:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add ability to collocate pinned and unpinned instance on same host

Add support for configuring `cpu_dedicated_set` parameter
and modify logic for `vcpu_pin_set` and `cpu_shared_set` parameters
to add ability to collocate pinned and unpinned instances on same host.

Deprecate `vcpu_pin_set` option as it is deprecated from config
options in nova [1] as well.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/671793

Change-Id: I40e0ed0bba93bfcdc4cf157195c3e9fbcfce0776
(cherry picked from commit cf666bd557d2d5b94774cace4b09d91ea5822c2c)

messages:
[{'account_id': 29870, 'date': '2019-07-15 03:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-07-15 03:16:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2019-07-15 03:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks for contribute, the owner of ipsec.secrets is root, and the pluto process also running as root. Could you summit a bug in Launchpad to describe how to reproduce?'}, {'account_id': 29870, 'date': '2019-07-15 06:54:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-15 03:16:13.000000000', 'message': 'Change ownership of ipsec.secrets with "run_as_root=True"

When restart l3 agent or ha router state changes, changing owership
of 'ipsec.secrets' will appers 'Operation not permitted', so we
can add 'run_as_root=True' parameter to the corresponding methords.

Change-Id: I7a99e74df1a602bf5e818a89731c7e0eb0d6ec04
'}]
commit_message:
Change ownership of ipsec.secrets with "run_as_root=True"

When restart l3 agent or ha router state changes, changing owership
of 'ipsec.secrets' will appers 'Operation not permitted', so we
can add 'run_as_root=True' parameter to the corresponding methords.

Change-Id: I7a99e74df1a602bf5e818a89731c7e0eb0d6ec04

commit_message:
Add functional test for two-cell scheduler behaviors

This adds a functional test to validate migrate-related behaviors
with multiple cells. We can't migrate across cells yet and this
validates that such an operation is properly blocked.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Related to blueprint cells-aware-api
Change-Id: I79736624dbebd7085fd8a5fe810a80312ebb367f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-30 06:07:31.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

The new job tempest-full-py3-opensuse15 use the opensuse-15 nodeset,
change tempest-full-py3-opensuse150 to tempest-full-py3-opensuse15.

Change-Id: Ida6b3f115d987b85e811be246468acd290f6c911
(cherry picked from commit 604efd382a9ca32935f95da3de59136690ebf33f)
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

The new job tempest-full-py3-opensuse15 use the opensuse-15 nodeset,
change tempest-full-py3-opensuse150 to tempest-full-py3-opensuse15.

Change-Id: Ida6b3f115d987b85e811be246468acd290f6c911
(cherry picked from commit 604efd382a9ca32935f95da3de59136690ebf33f)

commit_message:
Remove invalid none value judgment

volume will never be none here, so we can remove the none
value judgment and improve the code execution efficiency.

Change-Id: I5d35eebda6d4e9d8fd31a2e32cbcc68632afb2c8

commit_message:
Add trgger start and end time value check

Currently, karbor do not check start time and end
time value, so the end time may be early than start
time. This patch will fix it.
Story: 2006402
Task: 36284

Change-Id: If8909c9abd6fdcd7ce2e85a61472a8dc43f6fe51

Drop common-db tag from db_sync task

placement_db_sync has no relation to common-db, and independent step
during glance configuration. common-db tag should be applied only
to the common tasks

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-18 13:25:41.000000000', 'message': "Set bridge-nf-call-* values to 1

Although the kernel default is 1, some distros override the defaults
via sysctl.conf. Loading br_netfilter manually will show values of
1, but then doing a 'sysctl network restart' will set the values to
0--so go ahead and override these values.

Co-Author: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I53dec308d359b27e62ed44e91a8eaae38d945a4f
Closes-Bug: #1843259
(cherry picked from commit 3d722dbc810b0f9521ce1cfc461789bdfe20e36d)
"}]
commit_message:
Set bridge-nf-call-* values to 1

Although the kernel default is 1, some distros override the defaults
via sysctl.conf. Loading br_netfilter manually will show values of
1, but then doing a 'sysctl network restart' will set the values to
0--so go ahead and override these values.

Co-Author: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I53dec308d359b27e62ed44e91a8eaae38d945a4f
Closes-Bug: #1843259
(cherry picked from commit 3d722dbc810b0f9521ce1cfc461789bdfe20e36d)

commit_message:
Bump rabbitmq & erlang versions

This patch updates rabbitmq to the new 3.8 version.

In addition it makes SUSE use the upstream repos for RabbitMQ and
the devel:languages:erlang:Factory for Erlang.

As all distros are using rabbit 3.8 we can drop checking
3.7 style cluster_status output.

Change-Id: Ibf87ccb4554ab7d765d542f5fae3cd857dbf5733
(combined cherry picked from commits:
 - 427ab54f39899f2e4a86a8968edeeb9353beea9f
- 246ff262e5969aebfe3b864bec63e89c8479f281)

revisions:

The skeleton role does not need to trigger tests with scenarios. It has no
production value and is only used for development purposes.

Change-Id: I0dc1be006d19a4eace3d6d2ad3a2d8f53263d6ef
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add the skeleton role as an irrelevant file for scenarios

The skeleton role does not need to trigger tests with scenarios. It has no
production value and is only used for development purposes.

Change-Id: I0dc1be006d19a4eace3d6d2ad3a2d8f53263d6ef
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

The code looks okay at first sight but that's probably not enough to warrant a +1 review, as I don't have full context."}, {'account_id': 28618, 'date': '2019-01-31 20:37:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Could you clarify how it's used? It would be easier to understand
 > the risks and the outcomes of this, because the aptly mirror isn't
 > exercised in gating yet.

Sure! This changes the mechanism used to mirror repositories in order to support multiple distributions and multiple components. Rather than merging all downloaded mirrors at the end of the build process, each combination of mirror, distribution, and component are all downloaded separately and published at the same time using flags, rather than merging into a single snapshot. The Aptly docs outline the process as well [0].

[{'created': '2019-01-16 22:46:15.000000000', 'message': 'mini-mirror: Add dist to mirror and snapshot names

Currently, mirrors and snapshots are tagged with package names before
they are combined into a final snapshot/published image. When duplicate
packages are mirrored across distinct dists, it creates a collision,
causing the image build to fail. This adds the dist to mirror and
snapshot names to prevent collisions.

Change-Id: Ib32a2adbb6d053a798d97eedb66e272c8961581d

commit_message:
mini-mirror: Add support for multi-dist publishing

Currently, mini-mirror combines all source distributions into a single
distribution and component when publishing. This commit changes the
publishing behavior of mini-mirror to separate distributions and
components for all published mirrors.

Change-Id: Ib32a2adbb6d053a798d97eedb66e272c8961581d

subject: Fix heat path for heat-engine service
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-31 16:31:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix heat path for heat-engine service

The heat services do not start, because systemd Execstart path search for
binaries in /usr/sbin. When using distro install method for RH7 OS
familly, the RDO package puts the heat binaries in /usr/bin. The used
variable heat_uwsgi_bin must be replaced by heat_bin.
This patch put the correct variable in defaults/main.yml for heat-engine
systemd config.

Change-Id: I11e4f40705958065f0dd267c6ca908dc0acd2479
'}]
commit_message:
Fix heat path for heat-engine service

The heat services do not start, because systemd Execstart path search for
binaries in /usr/sbin. When using distro install method for RH7 OS
familly, the RDO package puts the heat binaries in /usr/bin. The used
variable heat_uwsgi_bin must be replaced by heat_bin.
This patch put the correct variable in defaults/main.yml for heat-engine
systemd config.

Change-Id: I11e4f40705958065f0dd267c6ca908dc0acd2479

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 18:25:15.000000000', 'message': 'Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change does two things:

1. In order to deal with existing corrupted RequestSpecs in the DB,
   this change simply makes conductor overwrite RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
   rather than append during evacuate before calling the scheduler so
   the current instance host (which is down) is filtered out.

   This evacuate code dealing with ignore_hosts goes back to Mitaka:

     I7fe694175bb47f53d281bd62ac200f1c8416682b

   The test_rebuild_instance_with_request_spec unit test is updated
   and renamed to actually be doing an evacuate which is what it was
   intended for, i.e. the host would not change during rebuild.

2. This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
   field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
   The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
   allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
   the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed. Note that as part of that, the confirm_migration method
in the fake virt driver needed to be implemented otherwise trying to
evacuate back to the source host fails with an InstanceExists error since
the confirmResize operation did not remove the guest from the source host.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I434af8e4ad991ac114dd67d66797a562d16bafe2 in Ocata.

Change-Id: I3f488be6f3c399f23ccf2b9ee0d76cd000da0e3e
Closes-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit e4c998e57390c15891131205f7443fee98dde4ee)
(cherry picked from commit 76dfb9d0b6cee1bbb553d3ec11139ca99a6f9474)
(cherry picked from commit 31c08d0c7dc73bb2eefc69fa0f014b6478f3d149)
(cherry picked from commit 8f1773a7af273e2739843a804fb4fe718c0a242d)
(cherry picked from commit efab235f88ac040ef9654c782236b83ffcb473e3)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change does two things:

1. In order to deal with existing corrupted RequestSpecs in the DB,
   this change simply makes conductor overwrite RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
   rather than append during evacuate before calling the scheduler so
   the current instance host (which is down) is filtered out.

   This evacuate code dealing with ignore_hosts goes back to Mitaka:

     I7fe694175bb47f53d281bd62ac200f1c8416682b

   The test_rebuild_instance_with_request_spec unit test is updated
   and renamed to actually be doing an evacuate which is what it was
   intended for, i.e. the host would not change during rebuild.

2. This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
   field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
   The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
   allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
   the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed. Note that as part of that, the confirm_migration method
in the fake virt driver needed to be implemented otherwise trying to
evacuate back to the source host fails with an InstanceExists error since
the confirmResize operation did not remove the guest from the source host.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I434af8e4ad991ac114dd67d66797a562d16bafe2 in Ocata.

Change-Id: I3f488be6f3c399f23ccf2b9ee0d76cd000da0e3e
Closes-Bug: #1669054

[{'created': '2019-04-02 18:25:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional regression test for bug 1669054

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts value.
This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only a few
compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an evacuation
can fail if the only available host is the one being ignored.

This adds a functional regression recreate test for the bug.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/api/client.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I71e9d8dae55653ad3ee70f708a6d92c98ed20c1c in Ocata which
added the 201 value to the check_response_status default.

NOTE(mriedem): This backport differs slightly in that
(a) REQUIRES_LOCKING is removed and NeutronFixture is
used explicitly since change I9b35ed7497db8bd1eb74f4bb89631aabbcfeec0d
is not in Ocata and (b) kwargs are passed through post_server_action
because change If7b02bcd8d77e94c7fb42b721792c1391bc0e3b7 is not in
